div.p: I did a lot of different training so I started off by leaving school with just 4 GCSEs, I then went on to do a National Diploma in Performing Arts.
When I became an administrator I worked my way up and did Level 1, 2, 3 in Customer Care and Business and Admin
and then obviously went back to do an evening course to retrain as a beauty therapist and then gained my qualification there as well.
I do like training and I’ll always look at other things that I can do because I think it just makes you feel more confident and
you can never learn too much it’s always good to know more but also all three things that I’ve trained in are
totally different so it’s good because obviously without my customer service and business admin I don’t think I’d be as confident
and you know get on with people as much as I do if I didn’t do that. I think the most difficult one was the beauty qualification
because the previous qualifications that I was doing I didn’t really have any other commitments but obviously I was working
full time, I’ve got my own house and so I was doing an evening class to retrain as a beautician and it was just a lot harder
because you don’t get the time to put in as I did when I was younger at college you know that was all I was doing 3 days a week
was a Performing Arts National Diploma so it’s so easy and I thought it was a walk in the park compared to learning all about
and what you don’t realise as well with a beauty therapist you have to go into all the science side of it so all the muscles and bones
which you know you don’t really think of that when you think of a beautician you just think make-up, tanning...
